column1: How can I get a passenger receipt?
column2: Let me quickly show you where you can easily access and download your passenger receipt: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/passenger-receipt\n\nPlease note: Your passenger receipt will be available for you to download immediately after your ticket has been issued and for up to 90 days after your journey has been completed.

column1: The service center doesn't answer
column2:
I'm sorry to hear that you cannot reach our service centers right now. Due to a very high number of calls, waiting time is currently longer than normal.

If you want to inform yourself about rebooking and refund options, I invite you to type "mainmenu". You'll see a number of options on how to proceed, based on your situation.

For more complex questions, I'd kindly ask you for some patience when calling the service center.

I'd like to apologize for the inconvenience this might cause.

column1: Where can I find out where to drop off the strollers I borrowed at the airport?

column1: Can I check in via the app, if online check-in is not possible in certain countries?
column2: In the event that you are unable to obtain a boarding pass when checking in online, you can obtain a check-in confirmation exclusively via the app. With this confirmation you will receive your boarding pass quickly and easily at the check-in counter of your departure airport. As usual, you will also receive all app notifications in case of information updates and irregularities.

column1: Can I purchase lounge access while traveling in Economy Class?
column2: Of course, you can purchase Lounge access as an Economy Class passenger (availability limited). To do so, present your valid Lufthansa boarding pass at the lounge entrance and simply pay by credit card or book lounge access online before your trip: https://lufthansa.travelintegration.com/lounges

column1: Is my seat reservation guaranteed?
column2: Normally the seat you have reserved will be available to you. However, depending on the load factor of the flight, seating arrangements might be changed at the gate in order to enhance physical distancing on board.\n\nRead why and how operationally necessary seat changes are handled and find more information on advanced seat reservation here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/seat-reservation#info

column1: Travel with pets in cabin
column2:
Small pets, who weigh a maximum of 8 kg including a suitable transport container, may be taken with you into the cabin.

Please make the booking for your pet in cabin at least 72 hours before departure here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/register-animals-cabin

Further information on traveling with pets in the cabin, including prices, can be found here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/animals-as-additional-carry-on-baggage

column1: Baby Bassinets
column2:
Special bassinets are available on long-haul flights. They are perfectly suited for babies under 11 kg in weight and under 67 cm in height. Depending on your booking class, a seat reservation fee my apply.
You can reserve the bassinet up to 52 hours before departure with the Lufthansa Service Center.

Find further information on flying with a baby here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/flying-with-baby

column1: WiFi access on board
column2:
On aircrafts equipped with internet, you can book internet access on board via the FlyNet portal. Please find more information here:
https://www.lh.com/xx/en/flynet

You can also book WiFi packages from the comfort of your home via the FlyNet app. Packages are valid for the current and the following three calendar years.

column1: Are baby meals available on board?
column2: Meals for babies and infants - such as baby food, mini sausages and soups - are available on board Lufthansa flights - while stocks last. We still recommend taking along your baby’s favourite food or bottle. We will happily warm it up up for you. There is also water suitable for baby bottles on board so that it is unnecessary to purchase water after you have passed through security control.\nMore information: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/childrens-menus-on-board

column1: How can I reserve an extra seat?

column1: Unaccompanied minor service
column2: Unaccompanied minor services are only available for children from 5 to 18 years with direct flight bookings (no transiting). The service is optional for children above 12 years. For children younger than 12 flying alone, the service is necessary and cannot be substituted. For further information visit:\n\nhttps://www.lh.com/xx/en/unaccompanied-minors

column1: Book animal in cargo hold
column2:
Dogs and cats that weigh more than 8 kg, including their transport container, can be booked in the cargo hold on certain connections. You can request a booking for your pet no later than 72 hours before departure here:

https://www.lh.com/xx/en/register-animal-cargo-hold

You can also register your pet no later than 24 hours before departure at your travel agency or via Lufthansa Service Center to receive a booking confirmation.

Further information on transport of pets in the cargo hold, including prices, can be found here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/transporting-animals-as-excess-baggage

column1: Will guests who travel together automatically be seated next to each other?
column2: Guests flying together have the option to reserve seats during the booking process, subject to a fee. \nDuring the check-in process, the system will auto-select the best available seat. If possible, guests traveling together will be assigned seats next to each other.

column1: Will we be seated together if we do not change seats?
column2: Guests flying together have the option to reserve seats during the booking process, subject to a fee. \nDuring the check-in process, the system will auto-select the best available seat. If possible, guests traveling together will be assigned seats next to each other.

column1: Are status customers on the waiting list still given priority?
column2: Status customers on the waiting list are still given priority.

column1: frequent flyer priority
column2: Status customers on the waiting list are still given priority.

column1: Will I be given priority on the waitlist as a status customer?
column2: Status customers on the waiting list are still given priority.

column1: Will a family be seated next to each other?
column2: If no seats have been reserved in advance, the check-in system will automatically select the best available seats. Depending on the load factor and the seat arrangement, these can be in one row or behind one another.

column1: Can we sit together?
column2: If no seats have been reserved in advance, the check-in system will automatically select the best available seats. Depending on the load factor and the seat arrangement, these can be in one row or behind one another.

column1: Do I need to rebook at my own expense, if I don't meet the immigration criteria to enter their destination?
column2: Passengers need to ensure their own immigration eligibility.

column1: Do I have to pay for a new flight in case i didn't meet immigration criteria?
column2: Passengers need to ensure their own immigration eligibility.

column1: Do I have to print my boarding pass and baggage tag at home and bring it to the airport?
column2: In order to avoid queuing at the airport, online check-in and printing the boarding pass at home is preferred. Where possible, baggage tags should also be printed at home.

column1: Do I need to print out boarding pass?
column2: In order to avoid queuing at the airport, online check-in and printing the boarding pass at home is preferred. Where possible, baggage tags should also be printed at home.

column1: Do I need to print out baggage tag?

column1: Are Self Bag Drop counters available?
column2: You will have the possibility to drop off your luggage at a Self Bag Drop counter at our hubs in Frankfurt, Munich, Vienna and Geneva.\nIn Zurich, the Self Bag Drop counter is not available. However, you can print a baggage tag (HomeTag) during the online check-in process and drop off your luggage at the usual bag drop counter.

column1: At which airports do I find the Self Bag Drop counts?
column2: You will have the possibility to drop off your luggage at a Self Bag Drop counter at our hubs in Frankfurt, Munich, Vienna and Geneva.\nIn Zurich, the Self Bag Drop counter is not available. However, you can print a baggage tag (HomeTag) during the online check-in process and drop off your luggage at the usual bag drop counter.

column1: Bag drop self service

However, you can print a baggage tag (HomeTag) during the online check-in process and drop off your luggage at the usual bag drop counter.

column1: Payments methods at the service desk counters
column2: At the check-in desk only credit and debit card payments are accepted. Cash payments are only possible at the service desk. Please, whenever possible, pay contactless using credit or debit cards.

column1: What are the regulations for liquids in my carry-on baggage?
column2: To pass security checks quickly, wrap all your liquid containers (each one max. 100 ml) in a resealable, transparent plastic bag with a total capacity not exceeding 1 litre. Present the bag separately at the security checkpoint together with any duty-free items purchased outside the EU.\nPlease find further information on liquids in carry-on baggage here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/carry-on-baggage

column1: How many liquids am I allowed to carry in my carry-on baggage?

column1: Are the fast track lanes at the security check currently open?
column2: Many security fast track lanes are open. In Frankfurt, Zurich, Geneva and Vienna the fast track lanes are available.\nThe Fast Track Finder will show you at which stations the service is available on our network: https://fastlane.lufthansa.com/

column1: How will I be compensated, while at the airport, in case of a flight delay or cancellation?
column2: A meal voucher is available for you at the airport if your flight delay exceeds two hours. The voucher is integrated in the barcode of the boarding pass of your disrupted flight. Participating Restaurants at the airport will accept the barcode as a voucher, which means, you don't need to line up at the service desk.

column1: At which airports is iCoupon currently available?
column2: iCoupon is currently available at the airports in Amsterdam, Alicante, Barcelona, Bilbao, Frankfurt, Geneva, Malaga, Valencia, Vienna and Zurich.

column1: Where can I redeem iCoupons
column2: iCoupon is currently available at the airports in Amsterdam, Alicante, Barcelona, Bilbao, Frankfurt, Geneva, Malaga, Valencia, Vienna and Zurich.

column1: How is physical distancing maintained during the boarding process?
column2: Please stick to the minimum distance when you're at the gate area and during boarding. You should remain seated until your boarding group is called. Listen to the gate announcements, follow the floor markings and use the quick boarding gates whenever possible.

column1: Is it possible to use priority boarding?
column2: Yes, priority boarding is possible.

column1: Are families still part of the pre-boarding?
column2: Families with children under the age of six are part of the pre-boarding. Families are asked to contact the agents at the gate.

column1: Can I bring my own drinks/food on board?
column2: You may bring your own food and non-alcoholic drinks on board.

column1: Do I get reusable and cleaned headphones on board?
column2: Earphones are still available. They are individually packed in a sealed plastic bag. In Economy, they are single-use items which you can take along if you like. In First and Business Class, the earphones are re-used after being cleaned, disinfected and repackaged into sealed plastic bags. On B777 and A340 airplanes, you can also plug in your own single pin headsets.

column1: Will I receive earphones for the entertainment system
column2: Earphones are still available. They are individually packed in a sealed plastic bag. In Economy, they are single-use items which you can take along if you like. In First and Business Class, the earphones are re-used after being cleaned, disinfected and repackaged into sealed plastic bags. On B777 and A340 airplanes, you can also plug in your own single pin headsets.

column1: Can I pass the passport control without physical contact?
column2: If you hold a European passport, you can use the automated border control gates. Please note that these can be closed at certain times due to the low demand.

column1: Is the Senator Hotline still available?
column2: The special hotline for Senators is in place and can be reached via the usual telephone number.

column1: Is the hotline for HON Circle members still available ?
column2: The special hotline for HON Circle members is in place and can be reached via the usual telephone number.

column1: Is the air conditioning turned on before take-off and after landing?
column2: The Lufthansa Group ensures that the ventilation in the cabin is active not only during the flight, but also during boarding, deboarding, and in transit, thus ensuring optimum air circulation. This ensures optimal air circulation and at the same time filtering by suspended matter or HEPA filters takes place, which eliminate over 99% of all hazardous particles, such as bacteria and viruses, and ensure that the air in the cabin is completely replaced regularly.

column1: When will I be informed if a fellow traveler tested positive for COVID-19?
column2: The local health departments are responsible for tracking confirmed coronavirus cases.  At their request, the Lufthansa Group may be required to pass on passenger data. Please be assured that the Lufthansa Group does not pass on personal data unless ordered to do so by government officials.

column1: Can I travel with children that have a cold?
column2: It is advised to only travel if all guests are  healthy.

column1: Where can I find information on the current flight schedule?
column2: You can find information about current offers and destinations here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/book/flight-information/timetable

column2: Yes, the First Class check-in is available.

column1: What is the baggage allowance for children? (older than 2)
column2: Children as of the age of 2 have the same baggage allowance as adults:  one piece in Economy class, 2 pieces in Business and 3 pieces in First class

column1: Kids baggage allowance
column2: Children as of the age of 2 have the same baggage allowance as adults:  one piece in Economy class, 2 pieces in Business and 3 pieces in First class

column1: Can I check in via the app, if online check-in is not possible in certain countries?
column2: If you check in via any online channel and cannot receive a mobile boarding pass, a check-in confirmation will be issued. With this confirmation, you can get your boarding pass at the check-in counter of your departure airport. As usual, you will also receive all app notifications in case of information updates and irregularities.

column1: Are baby meals available on board?
column2: Meals for babies and infants - such as baby food, mini sausages and soups - are available on board Austrian flights - while stocks last. We still recommend taking along your baby’s favourite food or bottle. We will happily warm it up for you. There is also water suitable for baby bottles on board so that it is unnecessary to purchase water after you have passed through security control.\nMore information: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/reisevorbereitung-mit-der-familie

column1: Can I take my musical instrument into the cabin?
column2: Provided your musical instrument does not exceed the dimensions or weight of a normal item of hand baggage, you can take it with you as hand baggage without prior notification. If your musical instrument exceeds the dimensions or weight for hand baggage, you will have to book an additional seat for it. Further information can be found on this website: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/customer-support/faq-help/baggage#a-Frequently20asked20questions3A20Baggage-14

column1: Can I take my musical instrument into the cabin?
column2: You can take your musical instrument with you without prior registration in the cabin if it does not exceed the baggage dimensions of 55 x 40 x23 cm and a weight of 8 kg. column1: Travel with snub-nosed animals and fighting dogs
column2:
Dogs and cats belonging to snub-nosed breeds have anatomically restricted airways with the accompanying difficulty in breathing. Therefore, they can only be transported in the cabin.

Dogs classified as fighting dogs may only be transported in special crates and exclusively in the hold.

Please find further information here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/dangerous-dogs

column1: What is the price for adding sports baggage?
column2: Sports baggage is free of charge within your baggage allowance. Sports baggage that exceeds your free baggage allowance will be charged in accordance with the ?flat rates for sports baggage. https://www.lh.com/xx/en/sports-baggage\n\nPlease note: Sports baggage over 32kg and/or 315cm is not accepted and must be shipped via air freight.

column1: How can I add sports baggage to my booking?
column2: You can conveniently take your sports baggage with you on Lufthansa flights. It needs to be registered latest 24h prior to departure. We therefore recommend making a reservation for your item(s) of sports equipment as soon as possible due to limited space in the cargo hold.\n\nPlease use the online form to register your sports equipment to your personal booking: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/add-sports-baggage

column1: How can I upload COVID-19 travel documents?
column2: In the period from 72 hours to 8 hours before departure, you can upload your travel documents such as COVID-19 test result, vaccination certificate, entry form, etc. so that they can already be checked before you travel. More information can be found here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/customer-support/digital-document-check

column1: Add your Miles&More number to your booking
column2: You can add your Miles&More number during the online check-in of your flight. It is also possible to process a retroactive mileage credit with Miles&More. For more details please go to https://www.miles-and-more.com and enter your question in the search function.

column1: I want to earn miles with my flight
column2: You can add your Miles&More number during the online check-in of your flight. It is also possible to process a retroactive mileage credit with Miles&More. For more details please go to https://www.miles-and-more.com and enter your question in the search function.

column1: I can't log in to my Miles&More account
column2: If you are not able to log-in to your Miles&More account or receive an error message, please contact our service team: https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact

column1: I can't remember my Miles&More password
column2: If you are not able to log-in to your Miles&More account or receive an error message, please contact our service team: https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact

column1: Access to Miles&More account denied
column2: If you are not able to log-in to your Miles&More account or receive an error message, please contact our service team: https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact

column1: Miles&More login doesn't work
column2: If you are not able to log-in to your Miles&More account or receive an error message, please contact our service team: https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact

column1: I can't find my Miles&More card
column2: Your Miles&More service card is available digitally in the Miles&More app at all times and you can use any service relating to earning and spending miles as usual. In case of theft of your permanent service card, please let your Miles&More service team know by phone. For more details please go to https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact . Your card number will then be locked and you will receive a new card number to earn miles. Plastic cards are no longer produced.

column1: Miles&More card stolen
column2: Your Miles&More service card is available digitally in the Miles&More app at all times and you can use any service relating to earning and spending miles as usual. In case of theft of your permanent service card, please let your Miles&More service team know by phone. For more details please go to https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact . Your card number will then be locked and you will receive a new card number to earn miles. Plastic cards are no longer produced.

column1: Miles&More card lost
column2: Your Miles&More service card is available digitally in the Miles&More app at all times and you can use any service relating to earning and spending miles as usual. In case of theft of your permanent service card, please let your Miles&More service team know by phone. For more details please go to https://www.miles-and-more.com/contact . Your card number will then be locked and you will receive a new card number to earn miles. Plastic cards are no longer produced.

column1: Travel with pets in cabin
column2:
Small pets, who weigh a maximum of 8 kg including a suitable transport container, may be taken with you into the cabin.

Please make the booking for your pet in cabin no later than 24 hours before departure here: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/contact-form-travelling-with-animals

Further information on traveling with pets in the cabin, including prices, can be found here: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/travelling-with-animals

column1: Travel with snub-nosed animals and fighting dogs
column2:
Dogs and cats belonging to snub-nosed breeds have anatomically restricted airways with the accompanying difficulty in breathing. Therefore, they can only be transported in the cabin.

Dogs classified as fighting dogs may only be transported in special crates and exclusively in the hold.

Please find further information here: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/travelling-with-animals

Dogs and cats that weigh more than 8 kg, including their transport container, can be booked in the cargo hold on certain connections. You can register your pet no later than 24 hours before departure.

Information on transport of pets in the cargo hold, including prices, can be found here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/prepare/special-care/animals-travelling

Please find this overview (in german) for any further information:

https://www.swiss.com/content/dam/swiss/pdfs/swissworldcargo/swissworldcargo-live-animals-DE.pdf

column2: When flying with Lufthansa with your baby or child, you will be in good hands as our special services are set up to cater to your needs.\nFind out more about traveling with a buggy or pushchair, child seat or baby food on board as well as useful information on preparing for a journey with your baby on this page: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/children-on-board

column1: How can I add sports baggage to my booking?
column2: You can conveniently take your sports baggage with you on Austrian flights. It needs to be registered prior to departure. We therefore recommend making a reservation for your item(s) of sports equipment as soon as possible due to limited space in the cargo hold.\n\nPlease make your registration via the service center contact form here: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/contact-form-baggage

column1: What is the price for adding sports baggage?
column2: Sports baggage is free of charge within your baggage allowance. Sports baggage that exceeds your free baggage allowance will be charged in accordance with the ?flat rates for sports baggage. https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/sports-baggage\n\nPlease note: Sports baggage over 32kg and/or 315cm is not accepted and must be shipped via air freight.

Sports baggage that exceeds your free baggage allowance will be charged in accordance with the ?flat rates for sports baggage. https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/sports-baggage\n\nPlease note: Sports baggage over 32kg and/or 315cm is not accepted and must be shipped via air freight.

column1: How can I add sports baggage to my booking?
column2: You can conveniently take your sports baggage with you on SWISS flights. Sports baggage has to be registered latest 24h prior to departure via the SWISS Service Center. We therefore recommend making a reservation for your item(s) of sports equipment as soon as possible due to limited space in the cargo hold.\n\nPlease find your service center contact form here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/customer-support/contact-us/excess-baggage-form

column1: Can I check-in baggage for my onward flight?
column2:
Usually your baggage is checked through from your departure to your final destination. However for some itineraries, your baggage cannot be checked through. Find out more on checking though baggage on connecting flights here:
https://www.lh.com/xx/en/free-baggage-rules#connecting-flights

In case of other changes or irregularities, please contact us directly at the check-in counter or reach out to our Service Center.

In case of other changes or irregularities, please contact us directly at the check-in counter or reach out to our Service Center.

column1: How can I get a passenger receipt?

column1: Damaged baggage
column2:
I'm sorry to hear that your baggage was damaged. There is a quick and easy way to report it and check your eligibility for compensation. Please choose the arrival time of the flight that transported your bag and file your report.

Until 3 days after your arrival you can report it here:
https://www.lh.com/report-damaged-baggage

After 3 days of arrival please use the following form: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/feedback?feedbackCategory=5#formular

column1: Which special meals can I order?
column2:
Passengers who require special food for dietary, religious or nutritional reasons have a choice of 11 different meals on Lufthansa-operated flights.

Special meals can be ordered up to 24 hours before departure. You have the option of ordering a special meal through your travel agency or online at ?https://www.lh.com/xx/en/my-bookings. There is no additional cost to you for this service.

More information: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/special-meals

Special meals can be ordered up to 24 hours before departure. You have the option of ordering a special meal through your travel agency or online at ?https://www.lh.com/xx/en/my-bookings. There is no additional cost to you for this service.

column1: Children's menu
column2:
With our children's menus our young passengers (from two years old) can look forward to a real highlight on board. Children's meals can be booked directly when you book your flight and at no extra cost on all Lufthansa long-haul flights and various European flights.

You are also welcome to order our delicious children's menus at a later date online up to 24 hours before departure.

Book your children's menu right away: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/my-bookings

More information:

https://www.lh.com/xx/en/childrens-menus-on-board

column1: COVID-19 infection: How can I rebook my flight?
column2:
Sorry to hear that and wishing you a quick recovery! The fastest and easiest way to rebook your flight: https://www.lufthansa.com/xx/en/my-lufthansa-id

Please notice, in case of a COVID-19 infection it is not possible to rebook your flight via the Chat Assistant yet.

Nevertheless, many of our fares can be rebooked. Please refer to the fare conditions for your specific booking. For more information on our extended rebooking options, please click here: https://www.lh.com/xx/en/my-bookings

Please contact your travel agency for bookings that were not booked directly with Lufthansa.

Please contact your travel agency for bookings that were not booked directly with SWISS.

column1: What are the food and beverage offers at SWISS?
column2: Enjoy a balanced menu in all our travel classes. Whether First Class, Business Class, Premium Economy, or Economy Class. Fresh and varied meals of the highest quality. Made with seasonal products, provided by local partners. That's what we serve you on board. Enjoy! We have put together all the information about our services for you here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/fly/on-board/food-and-beverage

column1: How can I order à la carte?
column2: Whether gourmet, traditional or wholesome, choose your favourite from six exquisite meals, and enjoy a gourmet dining experience above the clouds. For a surcharge, you can book these meals on SWISS intercontinental flights in SWISS Economy and SWISS Premium Economy. You can order your à la carte meal online here: https://www.swiss.com/content/lx/markets/xx/en/profile/login?deeplinkRedirect=true\n\nMore information: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/book-and-manage/swiss-choice/a-la-carte-dining

column1: How do I pre-order from SWISS Saveurs menu?
column2: In SWISS Economy Europe on flights with more than 50 minutes, you will be able to pre order your freshly prepared food from the SWISS Saveurs menu through the following web shop: https://www.pre-flight-shopping.com/en/?airlinecode=lx\n\nYou may order your preferred products from one month up to 36 hours prior to departure for a reduced price. Service and cashiering will be done on board by our cabin crew during the regular SWISS Saveurs service. This offer is applicable on all SWISS flights operated by SWISS Intl Airlines, Helvetic and Edelweiss.

column1: What is SWISS Saveurs?
column2: SWISS has extended its award-winning culinary concept to most European flights from and to Switzerland in SWISS Economy. With SWISS Saveurs, we offer you a wide range of culinary delicacies for every palate on most flights. We have put together all the information about SWISS Saveurs for you here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/fly/on-board/swiss-economy/swiss-saveurs

column1: Which special meals can I order?
column2:
Passengers who require special food for dietary, religious or nutritional reasons have a choice of 11 different meals on SWISS-operated flights.

Special meals can be ordered up to 24 hours before departure. There is no additional cost to you for this service.

You have the option of ordering a special meal through your travel agency or online at https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/customer-support/contact-us

More information: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/fly/on-board/food-and-beverage/special-meals

column1: Do I need a COVID vaccination certificate in order to fly?

column1: Do I need to wear a mask during the flight?
column2: On flights to and from Germany, there is no longer an obligation to wear a mask.\n\nAt some airports, it is still mandatory to wear a mask. Please check the regulations at the airports along your journey: https://www.lufthansa.travel-regulations.com/

column1: Masks: Which mask regulations apply at Austrian?
column2:
We look forward to seeing your smile again. Because on board Austrian Airlines flights, the mask requirement has officially been lifted. If you feel more comfortable "with", you may of course continue to use your mask.

However, please note that depending on the country of origin and destination, wearing a mask on board may be mandatory. We recommend that you inform yourself about the respective regulations of your country of departure and destination.

https://austrian.travel-regulations.com/?language=en

column1: How do I report a lost item in FRA?
column2:
If you have left an item on board one of our aircrafts or in one of our lounges, please report immediately to the local lost and found office upon arrival.

At Frankfurt International the lost and found office is located in the baggage claim area (Terminal 1, Area A, Level 0, Monday to Sunday from 08:00 to 16:00). For further information and the form to report your lost item online, please visit:
https://www.frankfurt-airport.com/content/fraport-travel/en/airport-guide/help-at-the-airport/lost-and-found-at-frankfurt-airport.html

column1: Damaged baggage
column2:
Please report damaged baggage immediately to the local baggage tracing desk or lost and found office so that an official report can be made.

In the event that you don’t notice the damage until you have arrived home or at your hotel, you must report it in writing within the legally stipulated period of seven days after your flight.

For more information please visit: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/missing-baggage

column1: Damaged baggage
column2:
I'm sorry to hear that your baggage was damaged. There is a quick and easy way to report it and check your eligibility for compensation. Please choose the arrival time of the flight that transported your bag and file your report.

Until 3 days after your arrival you can report it here: https://mybag.aero/swiss/damaged/en

After 3 days of arrival please use the following form to file your enquiry on damaged baggage: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/customer-support/complaints-and-compliments

column1: How can I travel with an animal?
column2: You can take your dog or cat with you on Lufthansa flights. Depending upon the kind of animal, its weight and size, and the regulations applicable in different countries, transport is possible at an extra cost either as additional carry-on baggage in the cabin or in the aircraft’s air-conditioned cargo hold. Please find more information here:\n\nhttps://www.lufthansa.com/xx/en/travelling-with-animals

Depending upon the kind of animal, its weight and size, and the regulations applicable in different countries, transport is possible at an extra cost either as additional carry-on baggage in the cabin or in the aircraft’s air-conditioned cargo hold. Please find more information here:\n\nhttps://www.austrian.com/xx/en/travelling-with-animals

column1: What do I need to consider travelling with pets in cabin?
column2: Please find a checklist for travel with pets in cabin here:\n\nhttps://www.swiss.com/content/dam/lh/documents/prepare-for-your-trip/baggage/travelling-with-animals/animals-hand-luggage/en-checklist-animals-cabin.pdf

column1: Pet in cabin form
column2: In order to travel with a pet in cabin the "Transportation of a dog/a cat as an additional carry-on baggage in the passenger cabin" form needs to be completed twice and presented at the check-in.\n\nPlease find the form here: https://www.austrian.com/content/dam/lh/documents/prepare-for-your-trip/baggage/travelling-with-animals/animals-hand-luggage/dog-form-cabin-05-2019.pdf

column1: What does waitlist mean?
column2: Being on the "Waitlist" means that your seat for the flight cannot be confirmed yet. This will be done by my colleagues at the gate as soon as free seats become available.

column1: How can I change a name?
column2:
First and last name of a booking may contain max. 2 letter errors in total compared to the identification document. A second name is optional and can be added to the first name field. Please note that this field allows only for a limited number of characters. First and second name will be stored by the system without spaces. So no need to worry as this is not an error and has no effect. Also wrongly indicated gender selections don't need to be corrected.

To check-in spell the name as provided in the booking.

If any other spelling mistake has been made during booking please contact our Service Center for support.

So no need to worry as this is not an error and has no effect. Also wrongly indicated gender selections don't need to be corrected.

To check-in spell the name as provided in the booking.

If any other spelling mistake has been made during booking please contact our Service Center for support.

column1: Why am I not able to see my boarding pass after check-in?
column2:
I'm sorry that you experienced difficulties retrieving your mobile boarding pass. Here are two potential reasons:

1. It may take up to 15 mins to be available within the app. Please try again in a few minutes.

2. Please mind that you need to check in for each flight with the app or website of the operating airline of that flight. For instance, if you booked a SWISS flight, you can only retrieve your mobile boarding pass via SWISS App or website.

column1: Visa form requirements not met for check-in
column2: One common mistake is registering the wrong 'Country of Issue' in the visa form during the check-in process. The 'Country of Issue' field in the visa form always states the name of the country you applied the visa for. For example, if you have a visa to visit Germany, then Germany is also the issuing country of your visa. Hence you would have to state Germany as the 'Country of Issue'.

column1: When can I check-in online?
column2:
You can check-in online 47h prior to scheduled departure. In rare cases the check-in might be delayed due to technical reasons. Please try again after an hour or two.

Check-in deadlines match the bag drop-off deadlines and can be found here: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/check-in-deadlines?intcamp=qnackitime

To find out more information on online check-in visit: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/online-check-in?intcamp=qnackitime

column2: To perform online check-in, spell the name as provided in the booking even if it contains a spelling mistake. column1: I have difficulties with the check-in process
column2:
I'm sorry that you experienced difficulties with your online check-in. Here are the five most common potential root causes:

1.  outside of the online check-in window (23h before departure)
2.  unsupported airline or departure airport
3.  spelling mistake in name
4.  visa form requirements not met
5.  cannot find the booking code

Please find more detailed information and recommendations on each root cause below.

Any errors with the title will not affect your check-in ability.\n\nIf any further error in filling out passenger data occurred during the booking, please contact our Service Center for support.

column1: Why am I not able to see my boarding pass after check-in?
column2:
I'm sorry that you experienced difficulties retrieving your mobile boarding pass. Here are two potential reasons:

1.  It may take up to 15 mins to be available within the app. Please try again in a few minutes.
2.  Please mind that you need to check in for each flight with the app or website of the operating airline of that flight. For instance, if you booked a SWISS flight, you can only retrieve your mobile boarding pass via SWISS App or website.

column1: Visa form requirements not met for check-in
column2: One common mistake is registering the wrong 'Country of Issue' in the visa form during the check-in process. The 'Country of Issue' field in the visa form always states the name of the country you applied the visa for. For example, if you have a visa to visit Switzerland, then Switzerland is also the issuing country of your visa. Hence you would have to state Switzerland as the 'Country of Issue'.

column1: How can I change a name?
column2:
First and last name of a booking may contain max. 2 letter errors in total compared to the identification document. A second name is optional and can be added to the first name field. Please note that this field allows only for a limited number of characters. First and second name will be stored by the system without spaces. So no need to worry as this is not an error and has no effect. Also wrongly indicated gender selections don't need to be corrected.

To check-in spell the name as provided in the booking.

If any other spelling mistake has been made during booking please contact our Service Center for support.

column1: How can I undo my check-in?
column2:
In the app, select the flight you want to check out for. Navigate the flight status tiles to the left to get to the "Change check-in details" option. Here you will find the option to cancel your check-in. 

On the website you can also find this option by starting the check-in process again.

column1: What are the regulations for liquids in my carry-on baggage?
column2: To pass security checks quickly, wrap all your liquid containers (each one max. 100 ml) in a resealable, transparent plastic bag with a total capacity not exceeding 1 litre. Present the bag separately at the security checkpoint together with any duty-free items purchased outside the EU.\nPlease find further information on liquids in carry-on baggage here: https://www.swiss.com/xx/en/prepare/baggage/hand-baggage

column1: Unaccompanied minor service
column2: Unaccompanied minor services are only available for children from 5 to 18 years with direct flight bookings (no transiting). The service is optional for children above 12 years. For children younger than 12 flying alone, the service is necessary and cannot be substituted. For further information visit:\n\nhttps://www.swiss.com/xx/en/prepare/special-care/children-travelling/unaccompanied-minors

column1: Which visa documents do I require for my trip?
column2:
The visa documents you require for your trip depend, among other things, on your nationality and destination. To ensure a smooth travel experience, we kindly ask you to research the visa requirements for your destination and any transit country. Please complete these checks prior to your trip and have the necessary visa documents ready to present at check-in.

To determine which documents you require, please visit the following site for more information on specific requirements:
https://www.iatatravelcentre.com/passport-visa-health-travel-document-requirements.htm

column1: How can I register my animal in cargo hold?
column2: Animals need to be registered for transport in the hold no later than 72 hours before departure at your travel agency or via our Service Centre.\n\nPlease find your Service Centre contact number here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/contact

column1: Can I travel with my pet in hold?
column2: Cats and dogs that weigh more than 8 kg, including their transport container, can travel with you in the cargo hold. Please note that this service is subject to availability and must be booked at least 72 hours before departure via?our Service Centre.\n\nFurther information on transport of pets in the cargo hold, including prices, can be found here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/special-care/pets/cats-and-dogs-in-the-hold

Please note that this service is subject to availability and must be booked at least 72 hours before departure via?our Service Centre.\n\nFurther information on transport of pets in the cargo hold, including prices, can be found here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/special-care/pets/cats-and-dogs-in-the-hold

column1: Children: Do children have to present a COVID-19 test certificate?
column2: Depending on the country of departure or arrival, a negative test result may be required for your children on a Brussels Airlines flight. Please inform yourself about most recent entry requirements by entering your flight connection: https://lufthansa.travel-regulations.com

column1: Can I travel with my fighting dog
column2:
Dogs and cats belonging to snub-nosed breeds have anatomically restricted airways with the accompanying difficulty in breathing. Therefore, they can only be transported in the cabin.

In order to travel with a pet in cabin the "Transportation of a dog/a cat as an additional carry-on baggage in the passenger cabin" form needs to be completed twice and presented at the check-in.

Please find the form here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/dam/bel/pdf/SN_GOPS_Form-PetsInCabin_DEC22_A4.pdf

column1: How do I report a lost item?
column2:
If you have left an item on board one of our aircrafts or in one of our lounges, please report immediately to the local lost and found office upon arrival.

For further information and the form to report your lost item online, please visit:
https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/extra-services/baggage/problems-with-your-baggage

column1: Children's menu
column2:
If you?wish to order a meal for your little one, you can request one free of charge on all our long-haul flights and in Business Class on short-haul flights.

You can request your special meal online when booking your flight(s). If you haven’t selected your special meal during your booking, you can still order one the latest 48 hours before departure through: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/my-bookings/retrieve-booking. 

More information: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/extra-services/meals/child-meals

column1: How to cancel my flight ticket
column2: If you would like to modify your booking, you can easily do so in our 'My bookings' section via https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/my-bookings/retrieve-booking, or you can contact our Service Centre via this chat, our social media channels, or via telephone. Please find all information on cancel and refund requests here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/my-bookings/cancel-and-refund-requests\n\nDid you make a reservation via a travel agency, third party website or a different airline? Unfortunately, in this case we cannot help you further with this change. Please contact your travel agency or the airline that issued your ticket for further assistance.

column1: I can't complete check in
column2:
I'm sorry that you experienced difficulties with your online check-in. Here are the five most common potential root causes:
1. outside of the online check-in window (24h before departure)
2. unsupported airline or departure airport
3. spelling mistake in name
4. visa form requirements not met
5. booking code confused with tour operator code

Please find more detailed information and recommendations on each root cause below.

column1: How can I change a name?
column2:
In case of a spelling mistake in your name, please contact our Service Centre for further support. Please note that first and second name will be stored by the system without spaces. So no need to worry as this is not an error and has no effect. Also wrongly indicated gender selections don't need to be corrected.

To check-in spell the name as provided in the booking.

column1: Document to travel with pet in cabin
column2: In order to travel with a pet in cabin the "Transportation of a dog/a cat as an additional carry-on baggage in the passenger cabin" form needs to be completed twice and presented at the check-in.\n\nPlease find the form here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/dam/bel/pdf/SN_GOPS_Form-PetsInCabin_DEC22_A4.pdf

column1: Can I check in via the app, if online check-in is not possible in certain countries?
column2: In the event that you are unable to obtain a boarding pass when checking in online, please check in at the check-in counter of your departure airport to receive your boarding pass.

column1: How can I upload COVID-19 travel documents?
column2: In the period from 72 hours to 8 hours before departure, you can upload your travel documents such as COVID-19 test result, vaccination certificate, entry form, etc. so that they can already be checked before you travel. More information can be found here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/plan-your-trip/document-upload

column1: Can I bring my assistance dog into the cabin?
column2: On Brussels Airlines flights, you can bring your assistance dog into the cabin with you free of charge. Service animals can only be booked via our ?Medical Assistance team at the latest 48 hours before departure through meda@brusselsairlines.com.\n\nPlease find further information here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/special-care/pets/service-dogs

column1: Why has the snack service been re-introduced? Have additional hygiene measures been introduced?
column2: On long-haul flights we serve a well-balanced meal with complimentary drinks. On short-haul flights, your can enjoy a wide range of snacks, which can be purchased from our buy-on-board menu.

column1: How can I order special meals?
column2:
Passengers who require special food for dietary, religious or nutritional reasons have a choice of 14 different meals on Brussels Airlines-operated flights.

Special meals can be ordered up to 48 hours before departure. You have the option of ordering a special meal through your travel agency or online at ?https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/my-bookings/retrieve-booking. There is no additional cost to you for this service.

More information: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/meals/special-meals

column1: How can I reserve a seat before check-in?
column2:

column1: Can I take my pet with me into the cabin?
column2: You can take your dog or cat with you on Brussels Airlines flights. Depending upon the kind of animal, its weight and size, and the regulations applicable in different countries, transport is possible at an extra cost either as additional carry-on baggage in the cabin or in the aircraft’s air-conditioned cargo hold.\n\nPlease find more information on https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/special-care/pets.

column1: How to book a baby bassinet
column2:
Special bassinets are available on long-haul flights. They are perfectly suited for babies up to 10 kg in weight and under 67 cm in height. Depending on your booking class, a seat reservation fee may apply.
Please reserve the bassinet well in advance through the Brussels Airlines Service Centre (72 hours before departure at latest and subject to availability).

Find further information on flying with a baby here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/special-care/families-and-children/baby-and-child-equipment

column1: Is my seat reservation guaranteed?
column2: With a confirmed seat reservation, you have not purchased the right to a specific seat number (e.g. seat 4A), but a choice for a seat category such as an aisle or a window seat. Seat allocation can be altered at any time, even after the boarding of the aircraft, for operational, security or safety reasons or for reasons of Force Majeure. In this event, we will always do our utmost to provide you with a seat with the same features (window/aisle) and adjacent seating.\n\nPlease find more information on advanced seat reservation here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/seat-reservation

Seat allocation can be altered at any time, even after the boarding of the aircraft, for operational, security or safety reasons or for reasons of Force Majeure. In this event, we will always do our utmost to provide you with a seat with the same features (window/aisle) and adjacent seating.\n\nPlease find more information on advanced seat reservation here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/seat-reservation

column1: Why didn't I get the seat I've reserved?
column2: With a confirmed seat reservation, you have not purchased the right to a specific seat number (e.g. seat 4A), but a choice for a seat category such as an aisle or a window seat. In this event, we will always do our utmost to provide you with a seat with the same features (window/aisle) and adjacent seating.\n\nPlease find more information on advanced seat reservation here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/seat-reservation

column1: Why has my seat reservation changed?
column2: With a confirmed seat reservation, you have not purchased the right to a specific seat number (e.g. seat 4A), but a choice for a seat category such as an aisle or a window seat. column1: Can I bring sports baggage on my flight?
column2:
You can conveniently take your sports baggage with you on Brussels Airlines flights. Please always contact our Service Centre as soon as possible, latest 24h before departure, as your equipment needs to be registered and limited storage space may be available on your flight.

Please find more information on traveling with sports equipment here:

https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/baggage/sports-equipment

column1: Can I take my musical instrument into the cabin?
column2:
You have the option of taking your musical instrument into the cabin. Depending on the weight and size, you can carry it with you as a carry-on baggage or you must book an extra seat. Large instruments (e.g. contrabass) can only be transported in the hold as part of the free baggage allowance included in your ticket.

Further information can be found on this website: 

https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/baggage/musical-instruments

column1: Baby food
column2: You may bring your infant’s food for consumption on board, including formula milk and jars of baby food. At the security checkpoint, you may be asked to taste the food to prove that it is indeed baby food.

column1: How long before departure should I arrive at the airport?
column2:
Arrive well in advance at the airport so that you have sufficient time to check-in your baggage, pass security screening and proceed to your departure gate. We recommend arriving with the following time allowance: 

Short-haul flights: 2 hours before the scheduled departure of your flight

Long-haul flights: 3 hours before the scheduled departure of your flight

For more information, please visit https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/check-in-options-and-info

For more information, please visit https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/check-in-options-and-info

column1: Why am I not able to see my boarding pass after check-in?
column2:
I'm sorry that you experienced difficulties retrieving your mobile boarding pass. Here are two potential reasons:

1. It may take up to 15 mins to be available within the app. Please try again in a few minutes.

2. Please mind that you need to check in for each flight with the app or website of the operating airline of that flight. For instance, if you booked a SWISS flight, you can only retrieve your mobile boarding pass via SWISS App or website.

In case of other questions, please contact our Service Centre or visit our airport check-in desk at the day of departure for further support in regards to your boarding pass.

column1: COVID-19 infection: How can I rebook my flight?
column2: Sorry to hear that and wishing you a quick recovery! The fastest and easiest way to rebook your flight is through https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/my-bookings/retrieve-booking\n\nPlease refer to the fare conditions for your specific booking. Please contact your travel agency for bookings that were not booked directly with Brussels Airlines.

column1: How can I transfer an urn?
column2: Under certain conditions urns can be carried free of charge as hand luggage or checked baggage (if safely packed and sealed in a neutral manner) within the free baggage allowance. If possible, please provide a death certificate for security checks. Please contact our Service Centre for further information.

column1: When can I check-in online?
column2:
You can check-in online 24h prior to scheduled departure. In rare cases the check-in might be delayed due to technical reasons. Please try again after an hour or two.

Check-in deadlines match the bag drop-off deadlines and can be found here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/check-in-options-and-info/check-in-times

To find out more information on online check-in visit: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/check-in-options-and-info/online-check-in-options

column1: Can I purchase lounge access while traveling in Economy Class?
column2: You can purchase lounge access as an Economy Class or Premium Economy Class passenger. Please note this service is only available during off-peak hours and with limited availability. If you want to buy access, you must go to the welcome desk of one of our lounges. Payment can only be made by credit card at the welcome desk.\n\nPlease find more information through https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/extra-services/lounges/brussels-airport-lounges

column1: Snubbed nose pet
column2: Dogs and cats belonging to snub-nosed breeds have anatomically restricted airways with the accompanying difficulty in breathing. Therefore, they can only be transported in the cabin.\n\nPlease find further information here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/special-care/pets/snub-nosed-dogs-and-cats

column1: Can I add a train ticket to my booking?
column2: If you’re traveling to or from Amsterdam, Breda, The Hague or Rotterdam, then we offer a two-in-one ticket for both your flight with Brussels Airlines and train journey on the InterCity Brussels-Amsterdam.\n\nPlease find more information through https://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/benerail

column1: Visa form requirements not met for check-in
column2: One common mistake is registering the wrong 'Country of Issue' in the visa form during the check-in process. The 'Country of Issue' field in the visa form always states the name of the country you applied the visa for. For example, if you have a visa to visit Belgium, then Belgium is also the issuing country of your visa. Hence you would have to state Belgium as the 'Country of Issue'.

column1: Dangerous goods and liquids
column2: Please find more information on dangerous goods and liquids through the link below.\n\nhttps://www.brusselsairlines.com/content/bel/markets/xx/en/extra-services/baggage/prohibited-items

column1: Travelling with families and children
column2: In case you need additional help on the day of your trip, we offer a wide range of possibilities to assist you before, during and after your flight.\n\nPlease find more information on https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/special-care/families-and-children.

column1: Where can I get tested?
column2: After entering your flight connection, our travel regulations sites will take you to an overview of all the test centers that are available at your specified departure location at the bottom of the page. From there, you will be taken to the respective websites of the test centers where the exact procedure and general conditions of testing are explained in detail: https://lufthansa.travel-regulations.com/

column1: Information regarding airports in Berlin
column2: From 8 November 2020 Lufthansa Group discontinued its services to and from Berlin Tegel (TXL). Your new connection to the German capital is via Berlin Brandenburg Airport.\n

column1: Berlin Tegel TXL
column2: From 8 November 2020 Lufthansa Group discontinued its services to and from Berlin Tegel (TXL). Your new connection to the German capital is via Berlin Brandenburg Airport.\n

column1: Berlin Brandenburg BER
column2: From 8 November 2020 Lufthansa Group discontinued its services to and from Berlin Tegel (TXL). Your new connection to the German capital is via Berlin Brandenburg Airport.\n

column1: What am I  required to do, if I develop COVID-19 symptoms after completing the online-check-in and answering health-related questions?
column2: If symptoms occur after completing the check-in, you must contact a call center agent. If you have symptoms you should also follow your country's guidelines and contact your doctor. The Lufthansa Group does not transport guests with symptoms or a proven COVID-19 infection.\n

column1: Are check-in counters equipped with plexiglass panels?
column2: Most airports have installed plexiglas panels. If that's not the case, alternative measures to ensure physical distancing have been implemented.\n

column1: Do crew members wear gloves throughout the entire flight?
column2: Our cabin crew members adhere to very strict and high hygiene standards throughout the flight. \n

column1: Are new destinations currenly added to the networks of the Lufthansa Group Hub airlines?
column2: Our network is evolving constantly. New destinations will be announced as soon as available on the website.\n

column1: Can check-in, baggage drop and ticket counters be found in the same location?
column2: Please visit the website of the respective airport to learn more on the location of check-in counters, baggage drop and ticket counters. \n

column1: Pet as hand luggage
column2:
Small pets, weighing a maximum of 8 kg including a suitable transport container, may be taken with you into the cabin.

Please make the booking for your pet in cabin well in advance via our Service Centre. Further information on traveling with pets in the cabin, including prices, can be found here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/special-care/pets/cats-and-small-dogs-in-the-cabin

column1: Dog as carry-on
column2:
Small pets, weighing a maximum of 8 kg including a suitable transport container, may be taken with you into the cabin.

Please make the booking for your pet in cabin well in advance via our Service Centre. Further information on traveling with pets in the cabin, including prices, can be found here: https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/special-care/pets/cats-and-small-dogs-in-the-cabin

column1: Has the food and beverage offer been changed in the lounges?
column2:
We are constantly working on expanding our offer and offering you familiar services. Find more information about our lounges at:

 https://www.brusselsairlines.com/xx/en/extra-services/lounges

column1: Are luggage items desinfected?
column2: The Lufthansa Group decided not to actively disinfect baggage.\n

column1: How is physical distancing maintained during immigration?
column2: The Lufthansa Group has no influence on the measures taken at immigration queues worldwide.\n

column1: Can I bring additional liquids onboard such as hand sanitizer?
column2: The regulations on liquids taken in hand luggage have not changed. Hand sanitizer must also be carried in a container with a maximum capacity of 100 ml. In total, the liquids may not exceed one litre and must fit into a corresponding plastic bag. \nSanitizer may also be carried in the checked baggage.\n

column1: How can I check my flight booking status ?
column2: To receive direct information from Brussels Airlines about your flights, please provide your contact information within your booking. You can also find flight status information on our website via https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/plan-your-trip/arrivals-and-departures#/\n

column1: Confirmation about my flight
column2: To receive direct information from Brussels Airlines about your flights, please provide your contact information within your booking. You can also find flight status information on our website via https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/plan-your-trip/arrivals-and-departures#/\n

column1: How am I informed, in case my flight is cancelled?
column2: To receive direct information from Brussels Airlines about your flights, please provide your contact information within your booking. You can also find flight status information on our website via https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/plan-your-trip/arrivals-and-departures#/\n

column1: Need help to check Status of Flights to India
column2: To receive direct information from Brussels Airlines about your flights, please provide your contact information within your booking. You can also find flight status information on our website via https://www.brusselsairlines.com/be/en/plan-your-trip/arrivals-and-departures#/\n

column1: Will a family be seated next to each other?
column2: We will always do our utmost to assign seats next to each other for guests traveling together, if possible. If no seats have been reserved in advance, the check-in system will automatically select the best available seats. Depending on the load factor and the seat arrangement, these can be in one row or behind one another.\n

column1: Will guests who travel together automatically be seated next to each other?
column2: We will always do our utmost to assign seats next to each other for guests traveling together, if possible. If no seats have been reserved in advance, the check-in system will automatically select the best available seats. Depending on the load factor and the seat arrangement, these can be in one row or behind one another.\n

column1: Are check-in kiosks available at the airports?
column2: Yes, kiosk services are available at Brussels Airport. For other stations, please contact the local airport. \n

column1: What can I do, if I feel like other guests do not adhere to the physical distancing rules?
column2: Please consult the Brussels Airlines ground staff or the cabin crew for advise and support.\n

column1: Are the fast track lanes at the security check currently open?
column2: In Brussels, the fast track lanes are available.\nThe Fast Track Finder will show you at which stations the service is available on our network: https://fastlane.lufthansa.com/\n

column1: Can I check-in baggage for my onward flight?
column2: Baggage will usually be checked until your final destination. Our staff at the check-in counter will inform you about special regulations for your itinerary.\n

column1: Do i need to re-check-in my baggage for my onward flight?
column2: Baggage will usually be checked until your final destination. Our staff at the check-in counter will inform you about special regulations for your itinerary.\n

column1: do I have to pick-up my luggage at the transit airport`?
column2: Baggage will usually be checked until your final destination. Our staff at the check-in counter will inform you about special regulations for your itinerary.\n

column1: can I check my bags through
column2: Baggage will usually be checked until your final destination. Our staff at the check-in counter will inform you about special regulations for your itinerary.\n

column1: check in baggage for all flights
column2: Baggage will usually be checked until your final destination. Our staff at the check-in counter will inform you about special regulations for your itinerary.\n

column1: Service Centre is unreachable
column2:
I'm sorry to hear that you cannot reach our Service Centre right now. Due to a very high number of calls, waiting time is currently longer than normal.

Please note that you can also reach us through our social media channels and we will try to respond to you as soon as possible.

I'd like to apologize for the inconvenience this might cause.

column1: Are children given toys on flights?
column2: My colleagues on board will hand out great children's toys, such as colouring books and puzzles. Exceptions may apply on certain routes. Find more information on flying with small children online:\nhttps://www.austrian.com/xx/en/families-on-board

column1: Are baby meals available on board?
column2: Meals for babies and infants - such as vegetable and fruit porridge - are available on board intercontinental Swiss flights - while stocks last. We still recommend taking along your baby’s favourite food or bottle. We will happily warm it up for you. There is also water suitable for baby bottles on board so that it is unnecessary to purchase water after you have passed through security control.

column1: Children's menu
column2:
With our children's menus our young passengers (from two years old) can look forward to a real highlight on board. Children's meals can be booked directly when you book your flight and at no extra cost on all Austrian long-haul flights and various European flights.

You are also welcome to order our delicious children's menus at a later date online up to 24 hours before departure.

Book your children's menu right away: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/profile/login

More information:

https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/reisevorbereitung-mit-der-familie#child-menu

column1: Which special meals can I order?
column2:
Passengers who require special food for dietary, religious or nutritional reasons have a choice of 12 different meals on Austrian-operated flights.

Special meals can be ordered up to 24 hours before departure. You have the option of ordering a special meal through your travel agency or online at ?https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/profile/login. There is no additional cost to you for this service.

More information: https://www.austrian.com/xx/en/special-menus
